Dear Ms. Lukowski:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 4/18/2024 . Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective
action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this
letter and must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone

Sincerely,
Pinkey Brown, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except for
the following:
CPA Rule 400.12203 Financial stability
• (1) An agency shall demonstrate sufficient
financing, on an ongoing basis, to ensure the
agency is carrying out its programs and meeting
the requirements for licensing. A plan of
financing must include all the following:
• (e) An audit of all financial accounts
conducted annually by an independent
certified public accountant not
administratively related to the agency. A
copy of the audit shall be available to the
department upon request.
The agency did not have an annual audit conducted by an independent certified
public accountant.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas.
• There was no technical assistance requested or required.

V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• There was no consultation requested or required.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during
this period under review.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment (CAA) was discussed on site with the chief
administrator on 4/15/2024. The Chief Administrator (CA) reported there were no
rules/policies in non-compliance during the last inspection review. She reported
the agency was complying with applicable provisions of the licensing rules. She
reported that Morning Star Adoption Center is a non-contracted Child Placing
Agency that evaluate, place, and supervise adoption clients only.
Financial Overview
The agency provided an annual budget and a budget statement of activity dated
January – December 2023. However, they did not have an annual budget by an
independent certified public accountant.
Staff Interviews
Two staff were interviewed onsite 4/15/2024. Staff reported the agency is a
relatively small agency and everyone gets along fine. Staff reported feeling very
supportive. She reported staff work independently and they have a small amount
of turn over. One staff reported they are trusted to get their work completed and
they provide quality work. The only thing staff stated they would change is the
court system from county to county. Staff reported some of the courts from
different counties do not work within a specify time frame and this can hold up the
adoption process.

Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency maintains sufficient office space, equipment and supplies to ensure
delivery of adoption services. All files were stored securely and there is a cross
shredder for CHRI.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
This agency is not contracted with MDHHS to provide foster care placement or
certification services; therefore, this is not applicable.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
